English[edit]

Proper noun[edit]

Tee

  1. An Ogoni language spoken in Nigeria.

German[edit]

German Wikipedia has an article on:
Tee
Wikipedia de

Etymology 1[edit]

From Min Nan 茶 (tê).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /teː/, [tʰeː]
  • audio
    		(file)
  • Rhymes: -eː

Noun[edit]

Tee m (genitive Tees, plural Tees)

  1. tea (drink made by infusing parts of a plant, especially leaves or buds of Camellia sinensis, in water)

Declension[edit]

indef.def.noundef.noun

genitiveeinesdesTeesderTees
dativeeinemdemTeedenTees
accusativeeinendenTeedieTees

Descendants[edit]

  • → German Low German: Tee
    • Plautdietsch: Tee
  • → Estonian: tee
  • → Hunsrik: Tee
  • → Lower Sorbian: tej
  • → Romansch: te, té, tè
  • → Saterland Frisian: Tee
  • → Silesian: tyj
    • → Slovene: te (dialectal)
  • → Silesian German: Tee
  • → Vilamovian: tyy
  • → Zipser German: Tee

Etymology 2[edit]

Borrowed from English tee.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /tiː/, [tʰiː]
  • Rhymes: -iː

Noun[edit]

Tee n (genitive Tees, plural Tees)

  1. (golf) tee

Hunsrik[edit]

Tee

Etymology[edit]

From German Tee, from Min Nan 茶 (tê).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /tʰeː/

Noun[edit]

Tee m (plural Tee)

  1. maté (hot drink made from the Ilex paraguarensis plant)
    Vaam-mer en Tee drinke?
    Let's drink some maté?

Further reading[edit]

  • Online Hunsrik Dictionary

Pennsylvania German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From German Tee, from Min Nan 茶 (tê).

Noun[edit]

Tee m

  1. tea

Tagalog[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Hokkien 鄭／郑 (Tīⁿ).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /tiː/

Proper noun[edit]

Tee

  1. A surname​ of Chinese origin.

Noun[edit]

Tee
